reviews.review: A throwback to a traditional murder mystery with a lot of humor thrown in.  You literally will not be able to guess "whodoneit" until that point where the detective recaps everything into a nicely explained revelation.  And the running gag of one of the main characters is ingenious.  Unfortunately, its release so near the holiday blockbuster season may mean too many people will miss it in theaters.  Don't!
Slow methodical beginning to a manufactured outcome to attempt to show off some screen writersâ€™ cleverness. There are better more plausible mysteries on TV.

American claptrap of the worst kind. Overlong, boring, dependent on showing you whodunnit, and worst of all, Daniel Craig with a phone Southern accent and a name to conjure Poirot.  Enough to make me give up seeing US films for a year. Soooooo dull. Yawn. Stay home and save your $.
One of the best movies of the year. Movie keeps you engaged till the very end.

It was alright. From a surface level perspective, it was serviceable. Not particularly intelligent or extraordinary in any way. As a "who-dun-it", it's actually quite ineffective, since it doesn't really surprise you. And anything yhat does surprise you, doesn't really make all that much sense. It's more for shock value rather than in-depth quality. But at least it wasn't terrible. The polotics, however....should probably stay out of it.

Kept you guessing.
Humorous 
A very entertaining enjoyable film.
Slow, was well shot but I did sleep through most of it..

If you loved Agatha Christie, Nero Wolfe and classic murder mysteries, or you have a family that makes holidays as stressful as a mafia summit, then this movie is a must for you.  Knives out avoids formula for its plot, while still squeezing in every trope from the genre you were hoping to see.  Classic done modern, a homage that actually works as a modern work.

Knives out has super interesting plot with great actors that are easy to love. It has a slightly serious tone that lets the ridiculousness of the characters shine through. The movie was very funny and is one that is enjoyable for many different kinds of people and ages.
A fantastic time at the cinema. This mystery is fun, exciting and funny. the character's are absolutely great. Definitely check this out. Rian Johnson did an amazing job with this.
